Articles.Content:
(If this is in the wrong section, I am sorry but it seemed to be the most fitting place to put it)

Hello all and welcome to the Trick Space Program. I am the leader, and only real-life member, Tricksterzzzz. I prefer to be called Trick, but the Z's come from falling asleep on the keyboard. 2 years later, its too late to change.

Purpose of thread

The idea of this is to share with the KSP community my important missions in my first career mode in KSP. It wont include all flights, but I will share the most interesting ones to me. Its awkward to take pictures right now because I have to PrntScr, Paste into Paint (or other) and save, repeat. If anyone has any software that I can use, and is free, that would be helpful.

Missions

Here I will list any missions I post. They will be posted in a reply in this thread, then put them in this section here.

Current Questions

None!

The creation of the TSP

(Custom is normal but with double money, because i'm rubbish with money keeping)

The first ever craft of the TSP!

And it flies too! (I honestly expected it to crash or something..)

Unable to drop the side rockets, the center rocket had trouble keeping up, lost some speed but eventually was able to regain it.

This seems really really high for the first mission... Cant complain

Coming back down...Readying my self for stuff to explode

I almost forgot the parachute! Whew...

We still exploded, but Jeb survived! Luckily this wasnt a science mission or this would be a disaster.

Mission: Successful!

Evaluation:

Missions was successful. We got to where we aimed to go and further! Impressed but landing could of been better. May be best to invest in landing legs soon so we can land without explosions most of the time.

Aim for next missions:

Land on terrain and not water, try to obtain as close to orbit as possible.

Edited October 16, 2014 by Tricksterzzzz
Added Spoiler tag

Interesting mission, looking forward to see more.

The blue marker on the navball is the maneuver node.

The bright blue ones are radial in/radial out.

The pink ones are normal/anti normal.

Good luck for your next flights.
Try F1 for a screenshot which will be saved in a screenshot folder in with ksp's program files. Should save some work!
